Package nl.pim16aap2.bigdoors.api

Interface IConfigLoader

All Superinterfaces:
IRestartable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConfigLoaderSpigot
public interface IConfigLoader extends IRestartable
Represents a config with general options.
Author:
Pim

    initialize, shutDown

  • Method Details

    • debug

      boolean debug()
      Checks if debug mode is enabled.
      Returns:
      True if debug mode is enabled.

    • specificationTimeout

      default int specificationTimeout()
      The amount of time a user gets to specify which door they meant in case of doorID collisions.

      This can happen in case they specified a door by its name when they own more than 1 door with that name.

      Returns:
      The amount of time (in seconds) to give a user to specify which door they meant.

    • flagFormula

      String flagFormula()
      Gets the formula of a flag. Used for debugging.
      Returns:
      The formula of a flag.

    • coolDown

      int coolDown()
      Gets the number of ticks a door should wait before it can be activated again.
      Returns:
      The number of ticks a door should wait before it can be activated again.

    • allowStats

      boolean allowStats()
      Checks if stats gathering is allowed.
      Returns:
      True if stats gathering is allowed.

    • locale

      Locale locale()

    • maxDoorSize

      OptionalInt maxDoorSize()
      Gets the global maximum number of blocks that can be in a door.

      Doors exceeding this limit cannot be created or activated.

      Returns:
      The global maximum number of blocks that can be in a door.

    • cacheTimeout

      int cacheTimeout()
      Gets the amount of time (in minutes) power blocks should be kept in cache.
      Returns:
      The amount of time power blocks should be kept in cache.

    • maxDoorCount

      OptionalInt maxDoorCount()
      Gets the global maximum number of doors a player can own.
      Returns:
      The global maximum number of doors a player can own.

    • maxPowerBlockDistance

      OptionalInt maxPowerBlockDistance()
      Gets the global maximum distance (in blocks) a powerblock can be from the door.
      Returns:
      The global maximum distance (in blocks) a powerblock can be from the door.

    • maxBlocksToMove

      OptionalInt maxBlocksToMove()
      Gets the global maximum number of blocks a door can move for applicable types (e.g. sliding door).
      Returns:
      The global maximum number of blocks a door can move for applicable types (e.g. sliding door).

    • autoDLUpdate

      boolean autoDLUpdate()
      Checks if updates should be downloaded automatically.
      Returns:
      True is updates should be downloaded automatically.

    • downloadDelay

      long downloadDelay()
      Gets the amount time (in seconds) to wait before downloading an update. If set to 24 hours (86400 seconds), and an update was released on Monday June 1 at 12PM, it will not download this update before Tuesday June 2 at 12PM. When running a dev-build, however, this value is overridden to 0.
      Returns:
      The amount time (in seconds) to wait before downloading an update.

    • enableRedstone

      boolean enableRedstone()
      Checks if redstone should be used to toggle doors.
      Returns:
      True if redstone should be used to toggle doors.

    • checkForUpdates

      boolean checkForUpdates()
      Whether or not to check for updates.
      Returns:
      True if the plugin should check for new updates.

    • getPrice

      String getPrice(DoorType type)
      Gets the door price formula for a specific type of door.
      Parameters:
      type - The door type.
      Returns:
      The formula for the door type.

    • getAnimationTime

      double getAnimationTime(DoorType type)
      Gets the animation time for a specific type of door.
      Parameters:
      type - The door type.
      Returns:
      The animation time for the door type.

    • logLevel

      Level logLevel()
      The log level to use.
      Returns:
      The log level.

    • consoleLogging

      boolean consoleLogging()
      Checks if errors should be logged to the console.
      Returns:
      True if errors should be logged to the console.
